description: The DoS trap indicates that the sending agent
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ALCATEL-IND1-IP-MIB::alaDoSTrap ALCATEL-IND1-IP-MIB::alaDoSType i 0 ALCATEL-IND1-IP-MIB::alaDoSDetected c 9999 ALCATEL-IND1-IP-MIB::alaDoSIp a 192.0.2.1 ALCATEL-IND1-IP-MIB::alaDoSMac s EXAMPL ALCATEL-IND1-IP-MIB::alaDoSSlot i 9999 ALCATEL-IND1-IP-MIB::alaDoSPort i 9999 ALCATEL-IND1-IP-MIB::alaDoSChassisId i 9999

description: index field for the alaDoSTable. Note: tcpsyn, smurf, pepsi and
variables.name: ALCATEL-IND1-IP-MIB::alaDoSType

description: Source IP address from recent suspect packet.
variables.name: ALCATEL-IND1-IP-MIB::alaDoSIp

description: Source MAC address from recent suspect packet.
variables.name: ALCATEL-IND1-IP-MIB::alaDoSMac

description: Slot on which recent suspect packet was received.
variables.name: ALCATEL-IND1-IP-MIB::alaDoSSlot

description: Port on which recent suspect packet was received.
variables.name: ALCATEL-IND1-IP-MIB::alaDoSPort

description: Chassis on which recent suspect packet was received.
variables.name: ALCATEL-IND1-IP-MIB::alaDoSChassisId

description: The pktDrop trap indicates that the sending agent
has dropped certain packets (to blocked IP ports
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ALCATEL-IND1-IP-MIB::pktDrop ALCATEL-IND1-IP-MIB::pktDropType i 0 ALCATEL-IND1-IP-MIB::pktDropIfIndex i 9999 ALCATEL-IND1-IP-MIB::pktDropCount i 9999 ALCATEL-IND1-IP-MIB::pktDropFrag s EXAMPLE

description: Reason index for why this packet was dropped
variables.name: ALCATEL-IND1-IP-MIB::pktDropType

description: Interface index (if_index) of ingress port of this dropped pkt
variables.name: ALCATEL-IND1-IP-MIB::pktDropIfIndex

description: The # of pkt drops (within a configured time interval)
of this pktDropType that triggered this particular trap instance
variables.name: ALCATEL-IND1-IP-MIB::pktDropCount

description: <= 512 bytes of the dropped pkt (dsmac[12], tag[4], etype[2], payload[..512] (0 if DropCount only)
variables.name: ALCATEL-IND1-IP-MIB::pktDropFrag
